parts.questionText: Factorise completely $2x^{3}-13x^{2}+6x$
The sine of an angle is 0.6, find the two possible values for angle.

questions.stem: A class of 12 boys and 8 girls took a test. The girl's marks were 3, 6, 7, 8, 9, 9, 10 and 10.

parts.questionText: Find the mean mark for the girls.
The mean mark for the boys were 8.0. Find the mean mark for the whole class.

questions.title: Mean Calculation

parts.questionText: The number $12250\times\frac{p}{q}$ is a perfect cube. $p$ and $q$ are prime numbers. Find $p$ and $q$.
$x$ is a number between 700 and 800. The highest common factor of $x$ and 12 250 is 250. Find the smallest possible value of $x$.
Given that $81^{2x}\times9^{x}=27$, find $x$.

questions.stem: Raj has 120 one-centimetre cubes. He arranges all of the cubes into a cuboid. The perimeter of the top of the cuboid is 20 cm. Each side of the cuboid has a length greater than 3 cm.

parts.questionText: Find the height of the cuboid.

questions.title: Cuboid Volume and Dimensions

parts.questionText: Rearrange the formula to make $g$ the subject.

questions.stem:
The table below shows the amount of time spent playing online games by a group of children in one particular week.

| Time ($h$ hours) | Frequency |
| :--- | :--- |
| $0<h\le2$ | 4 |
| $2<h\le4$ | 9 |
| $4<h\le6$ | 15 |
| $6<h\le8$ | 13 |
| $8<h\le10$ | 7 |
| $10<h\le12$ | 2 |

parts.questionText: Calculate an estimate of the mean time spent playing online games that week.
Explain why this is only an estimate of the mean time these children spent playing online games that week.
Calculate an estimate of the standard deviation of the time spent playing online games that week.

questions.title: Mean and Standard Deviation

questions.stem: Solve the simultaneous equations. You must show your working.
questions.title: Simultaneous Equations

parts.questionText: A bag contains black, blue and yellow balls. A ball is picked at random from the bag. The probability that the ball is blue is $\frac{5}{9}.$ The probability that the ball is yellow is $\frac{2}{15}$. Find the probability that the ball is black.
Another bag contains 10 red balls, 7 white balls and 8 blue balls. A further $n$ white balls are added to the bag. The probability of picking a white ball is now $\frac{2}{5}$. Find the value of $n$.

questions.stem: $x$ and $y$ are related such that $x$ is inversely proportional to the square of $y$.

parts.questionText: If $y$ is increased by 400%, find the percentage change in $x$.

questions.title: Percentage Change in Inverse Proportion

questions.stem: Solve the equation $x^{2}+5x-16=0$ by completing the square.

parts.questionText: Give your solutions correct to two decimal places.

questions.title: Solving Quadratic Equation

parts.questionText:
Underline the following ratios that are equivalent to the ratio $a:b$.
$\frac{1}{b}:\frac{1}{a}$
$a^{3}:b^{3}$
$3a:3b$
$a+1:b+1$
John and Sam each have an amount of money. The ratio John's amount: Sam's amount $=6:2.$ John gives Sam $13. The new ratio John's amount: Sam's amount $=2:5.$ Find how much money John has now.

questions.stem:
A baking school offers beginner, intermediate and advanced baking classes on weekdays and weekends in August this year. The matrix B shows the number of participants attending the baking classes in August.
$B=\begin{pmatrix}20&22&9\\ 8&10&11\end{pmatrix}$ (Rows: weekdays, weekends; Cols: beginner, intermediate, advanced)

parts.questionText: The fees for the beginner, intermediate and advanced baking classes are $30, $40 and $50 respectively. Represent the class fees by a $3\times1$ matrix F.
Evaluate the matrix $C=BF$.
State what the elements of C represent.

In September, there were a different number of participants attending baking classes. The number of participants attending beginner classes decreased by 20%. The number of participants attending intermediate classes increased by 10%. The number of participants attending advanced classes tripled. Calculate the percentage increase in the total amount of fees between the August and September classes.

questions.title: Matrices Baking Classes

parts.questionText: Solve $\frac{x}{5}+\frac{2x-3}{4}=-6.$
Simplify $\frac{2(p-3q)}{10r}\div\frac{(3q-p)^{2}}{r}$
Solve the inequality $x+1\le\frac{7x-2}{4}<\frac{5x+19}{5}$

questions.stem:
(a) Cheryl wants to open a fixed deposit account with either Bank H or Bank L for a period of 4 years.

| Bank H | Bank L |
| :--- | :--- |
| Fixed Deposit Account | Fixed Deposit Account |
| • Minimum deposit of $10 000. | • No minimum amount required. |
| • For the first $10 000, earn 0.05% simple interest per annum. | • Compound interest at the rate of 0.8% per annum. |
| • For the subsequent amount, earn 0.95% simple interest per annum. | |

parts.questionText: Cheryl deposited $30 000 into Bank H. Calculate the total amount in her account after 4 years.
Cheryl claimed that Bank H offers a better deal than Bank L. Do you agree with Cheryl's claim? Justify your conclusion with clear calculations.

The exchange rate between Singapore Dollars (S$) and Chinese Yuan (CNY) is $S$1=CNY5.33$. The exchange rate between Hong Kong dollars (HK$) and Singapore Dollars is $HK$1=S$0.17$. Tan is planning a trip to Hong Kong and Guangzhou. He finds these hotel prices on a website: Guangzhou Hotel CNY825, Hong Kong Hotel HK$825. By comparing the exchange rates, explain which hotel charges a cheaper rate per night. Show your working clearly.

Tan books 4 nights in the Hong Kong hotel and 2 nights in the Guangzhou hotel. He pays using his credit card. The credit card company converts the prices to Singapore dollars and charges a fee of $k$% for the currency conversion. Given that the total amount Tan pays for the two hotels, including the credit card fee, is $890, find the value of $k$.

questions.title: Financial Maths: Interest and Exchange Rates

questions.stem: (a) A is the point $(1,-4)$ and B is the point $(-7, -2)$. The point C is the result of the translation of point B by $\binom{5}{4}$
questions.diagramDescription: Diagram for part b showing Trapezium OABC. Vector OA=a, OC=2c, CB=2a. P on OA such that OP:PB=1:3.

parts.questionText: Find the length of AB.
Write down the column vector $\vec{AB}$.
Find the coordinates of point C.
Find the equation of the line AC.
OABC is a trapezium. $\vec{OA}=a$, $\vec{OC}=2c$ and $\vec{CB}=2a$. $OP:PB=1:3$. Express $\vec{OB}$ in terms of $a$ and $c$, as simply as possible.
Express $\vec{CP}$ in terms of $a$ and $c$, as simply as possible.
Explain why C, P and A do not lie on a straight line.
Write down the value of $\frac{\text{area of triangle OBC}}{\text{area of trapezium OABC}}$.

questions.title: Vectors and Coordinate Geometry
